events.title: Martin Luther King Jr.'s "I Have a Dream" Speech
events.description: During the March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom, Martin Luther King Jr. delivered his landmark "I Have a Dream" speech on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial in Washington, D.C., advocating for racial equality and civil rights.
events.significance: This speech became a defining moment in the American Civil Rights Movement and continues to inspire social justice efforts worldwide.

events.title: The Knickerbocker Storm Hits New York City
events.description: One of the worst snowstorms to hit New York City occurred on this day, dropping significant amounts of snow within 24 hours and causing widespread disruption.
events.significance: The storm was notable for its intensity and impact on urban life in the mid-19th century, illustrating early challenges of urban disaster management.

events.title: North Carolina Voters Reject Secession
events.description: In a referendum, North Carolina voters decided against secession from the Union, reflecting divided public opinion in the state amidst rising tensions before the American Civil War.
events.significance: This event highlighted the complex loyalties in border states and set the stage for eventual secession and participation in the Confederacy.

events.title: Alexander Fleming Discovers Penicillin
events.description: Alexander Fleming discovered penicillin, the first true antibiotic, when he noticed that a mold had killed bacteria in a petri dish, leading to the development of life-saving antibiotics.
events.significance: This discovery revolutionized medicine by introducing effective treatment for bacterial infections, dramatically reducing mortality from infectious diseases.
